Review: Great place to work. Great training and mentors. Easy commute and strong government cyber security presence. Learning is part of the ManTech experience. leadership is always helpful

I love my job and the people I work with. At ManTech, we have so many opportunities for professional development, like tuition reimbursement, training and a mobility program. I plan to stay at ManTech for a very long time and I really appreciate the way that they've handled COVID-19 precautions (I've been working 100% from home since March with no plans to return any time soon).

review_title: People do not matter to this organization
Review: People do not matter - it is all about the organization. If you need a job - work for them only to gain experience or buy time to look for a good job.

review_title: They are focused on their employees
Review: ManTech makes an effort to support their employees with various programs. They are happy to have you learn new skills and will help you with new jobs and challenge within ManTech

ManTech is your typical government contractor. The bid on lowest possible acceptable offer so don't expect to get paid nearly what you are worth. Also don't expect any upwards mobility unless new contracts get won. On the bright side they are a larger company and win contract fairly often. That are also an amazing entry point for getting into the tech field right out of school. They will assist with training and they will be more than happy to sponsor you for a clearance which will set you up for bigger and better things. They have been around a while so they know how to play the contractor game. The work may get mundane at times but corporate treats you well even if they under pay you. Even if you leave to somewhere else, once they have a contract to pay you well or promote you their recruiters will follow up to try and bring you back.

Very laid-back very disorganized Made to work long hours weekends holidays no time off for friends and family takes a vantage of people who are in need the people there don’t care about you at all all they care about is the bottom line
Great place to work as a recruiter. Management values ideas for process improvement and change. Great work life balance, supportive team, enjoyable office environment
Allows fraternization between coworkers. No ethical stantards in this company. Worse company I have worked with. Always looking put for bottom line and not ethical standards.

The position I was in was a solo Mantech position for a certain location. The pay was really fair for the location I was in. The benefits were outstanding. Had all that I need plus more, such as military leave and full tuition paid for.

Just like the TV show The Office I do work in a cubicle. I spent most my days going through emails and answering work ticket calls. My responsible is making sure Technical Support is provided to certain sites. The hardest part of the job is coordinating and making sure technicians get to the designated site to do repairs. The most enjoyable part is when I call the customer to check on the work and the job is completed to their satisfaction.
I have worked for several contractors in the past 8 years. So far, ManTech International rates among the highest, in my personal opinion, in education benefits and employee support.
Mantech is a family business that involved a lot of physical labor to do a tough job. However, the work always educating as there was always learning oppertuites throughout the day.

review_title: My manager was the worst I have ever had in my 30-year career. All he did was criticize, cut me down verbally and degrade me.
Review: I was not given any indoctrination to my job. No one offered me help or advice when I first started. I had to search and ask for the appropriate documents after being on-site for 2 months. There was no guidebook, instruction, or SOP for my position. I worked for a tyrant of a boss who changed his mind every time a document was reviewed. If you couldn't get into the boss's mind you were screwed.
You live and die by the contracts. If a contract is lost, so is your job. The company does nothing to incentives the employees that might come from the bottom line

employee_title: Field Service Engineer (FSE) Supporting the CECOM LCMC Software
Review: I had no issues working for this company and will work for them at anytime and any place. The management was great and took care of the employees. I recommend anyone to work for this company.

Received no support from them. There was a person from a different company on the same contract that was constantly finding ways to “throw me under the bus”. He had a history of this behavior. He even got involved with me dating. He constantly publicly inferred that she was a terrible person. When asked to stop he did not. I received no support from Mantech. He then continued the personal and professional attacks until a departure by me.

Work is good there are micromanagement people in leadership. Its like a good old boys club and the male managers are very sexist and can be rude. Some people mainly management can also be hard to work with,
It is a ok job, no a lot of help from upper management. I the pay is good for the area. If you just a mechanic your good to go just do your work and go home

review_title: Good work while it lasted lots of management turnover
Review: Good work while it lasted. A lot of management turnover. At times communication was lacking. I saw what appeared to be a difficulty in filling positions and forming teams in a timely manner

The company is only concerned with putting bodies in positions so that they get paid by the customer. They are much less concerned with quality employees and don't support remote employees as well as they should. They do pay pretty good and the benefits are decent as well.
Original company was absorbed by Mantech. I continued to serve and grow and obtain more responsibility but was not compensated as much as my peers were.
Great place to work. Great training and mentors. Easy commute and strong government cyber security presence. Learning is part of the ManTech experience. leadership is always helpful
it was fun to work with the company and for me to do my job and learn everyday to become success with my job and deliver the materials needed.I love it.

Send managers to training. Salaries were horrible for certain individuals and the lazy were more often rewarded. Managers only offered more money when current (valuable) employees submitted resignations - then everyone seemed to be open to conversations.

I honestly can say that you will be challenged. Daily you will learn skills critical to evvong and growing as a man and operator. Ultimately, this is fulfilling and the corporation is always supportive.

ManTech as a whole is a good company to work for. They have multiple programs put in place to help you better yourself. One the programs in place helps you transition within the company. However this program is dependent on your direct supervisors approval. With most of the work being for a contract, this can be hard to do. The main reason I have seen this rejected, was they don't want to lose a body on the current contract the person works on. Their benefit package is comparable to most of the other companies in the industry.

employee_title: Systems Analyst - General IT Support & Systems Administrator
location: General IT Support & Systems Administrator (Former Employee)
Review:
The company is very accommodating for reservists, they were very encouraging and supportive filling out all the paperwork to get paid while I was away.

Unfortunately, because of the way contracts work, I had to leave the company to seek career advancement through the VA ( the IT contract was unable or unwilling to provide it).

review_title: I was not paid equally as my co-workers for doing the same job
Review: I was kept from being promoted to a higher position with equal pay by management. I was told I had to prove myself, yet no other person was told that.
ManTech is a privately help corporation with global offices in multiple countries. I worked for a division in the US for US State governments that provides vital records management.

review_title: Overall a good place to work
Review: Overall a good place to work. A lot of the attitude of the work depends on where you work, with customer sites taking on the feel and politics of the client and changing as people leave and are replaced. On the ManTech side, their Mobility Program was not useful. Also, if you come to them with a security clearance, do not expect them to renew it when it comes time unless your current position requires it. Sadly, I found this out the hard way when I went to change jobs. The benefits were good and rank and file management really cared. I would work for them again under the right circumstances.

review_title: Extensive knowledge of the contract and subcontract field
Review: Learned a lot about the formal process of putting together a compliant subcontracts folder, working under a CPSR review, using IT to enhance the subcontracting process and working in a global environment.
Have not been impressed with how they handle certain persoonel issues. Several incidents reported to them by myslef and others that have not been corrected nor propely addressed.
They need to have more remote or partial remote positions. The work did not require you to be on site all the time. Working remote would give a better balance to life and work.
I did not work at a Mantech location. I worked for a military location which has it's own set of issues. Mantech takes care of its employees and compensates them well.

review_title: Quiet,noise free environment which is free from distraction.
Review: Workplace atmosphere is quiet and calm. Workplace expectation is for high production with minimal error in medical information abstraction. Management does exceptional job in providing breaks and morale encouragement.
ManTech is just a great place to work! They care a great deal about their employees and maintain an above average level of taking care of their employees. I'd highly recommend working with ManTech.

- Typical day at work, customer site day-to-day operations.
- I learned about corporate policies, procedures, and growing internally with the company and their goals.
- Company communicates well their expectations and strategic growth/ goals.
Not a bad company to work for. Salary is good, people are nice enough. I didn't get the sense of working within a team. Mismanagement seems to the norm unfortunatly.
Hiring process was seamless.They treat all employees with respect. Only issue raised was that salary was not comparable with market rate for similar positions.
wide variety of professional system support and solution-based IT services. A strong advocate of team work, and continuous self-improvement with a track record for delivering results.

I enjoyed my time with ManTech. I felt supported and empowered. The job is focused on providing exceptional performance to the customer, which is good. They give you anything you need in order to fulfill that goal.

review_title: Mismanaged contract, ran program into ground
Review: Management is only concerned about the bottom line. We very bad morale. One employee committed suicide on their watch. They made head scratching decision that basically ended the program. They also only gave us 5 days notice to obtain a Microsoft Windows 10 certification. If we didn't pass the exam they laid us off with no benefits. They are the worst government contracting company I have ever worked for. Would not even recommend them to my enemy!
Great place to work. Great training and mentors. Easy commute and strong government cyber security presence. Learning is part of the ManTech experience. leadership is always helpful

Good benefits, leave policy. Vacation, nice team, SO are friendly and helpful. Trainings available. Pay is low, and sometimes they end up hiring some incompetent people putting them in management positions., or critical technical position.

employee_title: Program Director for business opportunities for the NSA market
Review: Stay billable on contract and management will not bother you much. While Mantech owners buy minority companies, they usually fire minority management employees within 2 years of company acquisition or hiring. Mantech was a negative work environment.

review_title: Family atmosphere friendly environment plenty of training and education perks
Review: Great company work at family environment .Family atmosphere friendly environment plenty of training and education perks Supportive positive people. AWESOME
I would like to be a support admin so I can interact with numerous offices and people. The office I am in has a lot of turnover and i have to continue to train new people and pick up the slack.

this job is a stepping stone for my career, I knew that I was not gonna stay long at this job, it is too slow paced and the leadership is not there. there needs to be better control and pay better for what I did

One of the better contract companies I have worked for in my career.
Benefits are offered and affordable.
I would definitely work for this company again.
racism is alive and well at mantech. Just look at the senior leadership. No diversity at all. horrible, horrible, horrible, horrible, horrible................
Supported and Completed many work duty assignments while i worked for ManTech at LA AFB. Very large company to work for with many staff supported to government contracts.
Can't speak highly enough about our leadership teams and how important our mission is all over the world. Work is hard and requires thought but it is worth it.

review_title: Very top heavy. Many layers of management
Review: Current position is decent. Future is in question. This contract has a very top heavy management presence. Making it difficult to hire and fill openings. New hires just show up.

review_title: Excellent oppourtunity to develop and grow
Review: First job after retiring form the military it provided a great transition into the civilian sector. They provide excellent oppourtunities to use the skills gained in the military. The compensation and benefits were excellent.
It is a large company that is continuing to grow and has a variety of projects you can work on. They have a good team in HR to move to other contracts if you want. The training is decent
The company is willing to assist with career growth and coach you on your way. They provide several tools and workshops to help with growth as a person and within your career.
Everyone at the Stafford campus are easy to get along with. Every day you will learn something new to help advance yourself and your career. Work/life balance is a big plus.
Someone once said, when you walk into an office and you hear laughter. That office has a great office atmosphere. Co workers have formed a family like enviroment.

Terrible, will never work for this company again. Might be different for some people but I will never go back when I leave here. Hope anyone going here does research first they lie and they are un organized

employee_title: One of the senior PMs who gets a glass door office by the window
Review: Not a good place to work=HR and management are corrupt and allow ethics violations to persist. Dont take a chance and get caught in the mess. Many other companies in the area that are fair.

review_title: Make sure you find out how long the contract is!!!
Review: I left a long term contract working on a DOB contract and switched to a DOD contract. My SCI had to get reprocessed for this contract. To make matter's worse, the length of the contract was NOT what the recruiter had told me it was. My onsite manager was prior military and would yell at his staff. The guy would get in your face and literally yell like you were a private and it didn't help matter that the louder his voice got the louder mine got. It was a bad situation. I would never work for this company again but if you do talk to the manager because the recruiter was a liar. I would have been better of never taking this short term sinking ship contract with them!
The company has a dedicated group of personnel with outstanding leadership and mission goals. Holds a strong commitment to excellence and always puts the customer first.

I have worked on and off for ManTech as a Sub and an employee for over 20 years and has hired me back every time, I have had opportunities to grow as a manager, leading teams in technical writing, software testing and public speaking and training, and project management. I have taken advantage of the company benefits such as tuition assistance and ESOP. The leadership is positive and encouraging, they give all employees opportunities to grow in their perspective fields and/or lead teams. Culture on every program fosters fairness, cooperation, and collaboration. Teamwork and communication are cornerstones. I get to work with great people and I actually look forward to going to work every day.
Great place to work. Great training and mentors. Easy commute and strong government cyber security presence. Learning is part of the ManTech experience. leadership is always helpful

I like to stay busy on my job i like to keep moving to wear sometimes i dontbwant brakes l feel that the factory is where i need to be because i have experienced from work in the factory then anywhere else i appreciate this job for showing me the steps of the way i learned more about the presses and the machine s it self .

employee_title: Senior Manager, Engineering- Mission Support Services (MSS) Division
review_title: Poorly Managed with bias shown in many instance ("lists" of who is "in" and who is considered "out")
Review: Don't want to go into too much detail but ManTech has been known to do some rather unflattering things in some of their contracts, to favor their favorite children, while ignoring or not giving the same opportunity to others.

review_title: good at first , but got really old
Review: At first it was cool, but then it got old. Change in management made job stressful and less fun with the micro managing. Just got another offer from another company, about to put in 2 weeks notice

Supervisor placed personal rapport over mission accomplishment. Seriously lack any consequences for employees completing their assigned duties. Growth is practically non-existent. Employees that do not fall into the good graces of mangers or supervisors are often ignored and work is not recognized.

review_title: Horrible management , HR not squared away , low pay
Review: Rich raider ! Thats all I have to say its ok mantech does not have contracts anymore worth getting hired for ! Expect you to work for them , but they do not work for you when you ask

review_title: Lazy work culture made work meaningless
Review: The interview was strangely indicative of the work culture. Boss put feet up on the table at the group interview and talked about golf and entertainment, and almost nothing about the job. On the job, my cube mates literally drummed on their mouse pads for hours/day and management was fine with this, even though it was very disruptive of my work. Very strange. The laissez faire approach they took towards our work made the mission seem doomed to failure. Eventually I was compelled to leave in order to find more meaningful work.
This company was a good fit but the management was lacking. And the sense of direction as far as what work I did for the day. But the people were very nice there.

employee_title: HQ ACC Senior Information Systems Security Manager
Review: The individual employee was not as important as the demands and needs of a few individuals self-interests. Unprofessionalism, to include racially motivated harassment, were allowed and truly condoned during my 10 years with the company directly and 2 years prior to that on the subcontract.
Man Tech was a decent company to work for. Would have maintained employment if company had not moved out of state. Would love to work for ManTech again.

I've enjoyed my team and management. Good collaborative environment. Management stayed in touch and visited site frequently. Great PTO package. Very predictable hours with decent flexibility. The only downside is ManTech never provided career options to move ahead for more than one person on site. They provide a job but not long-term careers.
Would highly recommend, competitive salary, great environment, many additional job opportunities, developmental opportunities, collaborative environment!
This company is a good place to get started. Not a lot of growth but a lot of good positions to grow into and help develop your essential skills to whatever your career is.
Loved Working For ManTech. Great Policies. Amazing Benfits. Great program managers. Great way to get your foot in the door and work your way up the ladder.

review_title: They are OK and they have no problem laying people off
Review: ManTech is just another hum drum company. Nothing special, you are just another number contributing to the bottom line. If you clearance takes to long to come through, they will lay you off.
ManTech is a good place to work for people that are just starting out in the IT field. There is room for advancement and they do like to promote from within.

Mantech is taking on some cutting edge projects within the DoD and Intel spaces. They are willing to take on new work that has not been perfectly define and may not have requirements clearly established. This is rare within the DoD space but allows for cross-training and a huge increase in skills that you may not be able to pick up anywhere else.

Tried their internal mobility program that is supposed to help existing employees move within the company. Had applications sitting there for over a month without a recruiter ever responding to my follow-up. Very sad. Management is practically invisible. Very little coaching when it comes to new projects. "Figure -it-out-yourself" culture. Decent colleagues, though. Pay is decent, too.
Rarely have I worked in an environment where every action (onboarding, health care, security, etc.) was like pulling teeth. Not user-friendly.
Seems like HR are the only people who have their act together there - at least so far.

review_title: Good First Job after retiring from the Army
Review: Good First job out of the Army. Im just looking to relocate to Dallas, TX and they do not have a great deal of open requisitions for me to apply to. Overall nice workplace

review_title: High scores for a very good reasons: Mission, work life, managerial support
Review:
The mission is very involving when embedded as a contractor; you're a part of a team, devoted to the very best product and mission support.

Work life balance is incredibly satisfying. Overtime and time accounting in general is honest, not discouraged based on company bias. You gain as much as you give, compensation and time off are easy to request and gain approval without prejudice.

Management is involved in your personal pursuits, takes all feedback with a genuine interest in improving the experience. This is the only company I can think of that will support relocation to any contract, as requested, and try to find your match for mission, pace, and location.

Honestly, as a 15 year career FSO having worked billion dollar Companies, Mantech has been the right fit from day 1. It's a genuine partnership with our government that pairs talent with a vision for excellence in direct support.

review_title: ManTech is has a laid back culture and is a really great place to work.
Review: I worked for ManTech several years ago and returned because the commute was great. It's a great place that offers work life balance. It's a place where management truly cares about the employees.
Great place to work. Great training and mentors. Easy commute and strong government cyber security presence. Learning is part of the ManTech experience. leadership is always helpful

Spent a great deal of time with Mantech however management was by far the worst I have ever experienced. Supervisors were allowed to strike the chairs of employees in an effort to intimidate and chastise employees and often made up stories about I'll behavior to cast blame on others when they initiated such treatment on otuers

review_title: Worked with a great group of people
Review: The contracts group was a great group of people to work with that had each others back when needed (during proposals and other busy times). The job could be demanding at times however, requiring working over time to include nights and weekends.

review_title: I interface more with the client.
Review: I take work assignment from the client. Mantech/KGS management is not hands on with everyday work assignment with client, As contractor, I am seconded to client management and take work task assignment from the client.
I would highly recommend working for Mantech. They have so much to offer in benefits and knowledge. But it depends on the office/contract you are in because they’re not always the same.
Good company to work with,learned a lot about management and time sheet recirding. Workplace was cool and you are free to relax if you are not working

ManTech is not a healthy place to work. From the direct supervisor level, all the way to employee relations and everyone in between. There is favoritism, sexism, hostility, misinformation, and the good ol' boy network. They talk about growth and job advancement, but if you're a female or not a favorite, you'll stay where they put you in the beginning. The job I initially did in the beginning, is not the job I was hired for. I do not recommend ManTech to anyone who is serious about growing their career in a professional environment.
By the time i was able to start working the contract got bought out and I had to find another job. I wish I would have been able to work a little longer so that i would have learned the job better.

I was a contractor for a Federal agency. Your work was 100% dependent on the customers needs. There was no interference by ManTech though ManTech did provide plentiful training in regards to there expectations and operation security.
Employees work on government contracts and do not interact with ManTech management often. I have picked up many new skills related to VA systems and databases.

Excellent Company.
Good work, life balance.
Good benefits.
Get you own cubicle.
Management is generally reasonable.
This review is too long for my tastes, but I'm continuing to write
because the idiots at Indeed think this is really, really important.
Staff and management are very at tentative to their employees, Company provides a way for employees to grow their career path and professional skills.

review_title: Inspirational people to work with and fun, relaxed atmosphere
Review: Loved this job!!! DoD Contract at CSS in Panama City FL, Office Coordinator and Asst. Security Officer for 32 staff members (both onsite at U.S. Navy CSS and offsite). Required TOP SECRET security clearance. Traveled coast to coast on job assignments in support of contract. Technical Staff comprised of retired military personnel who were wonderful and fun people. Attended corporate headquarters functions in Rockville, MD, and met owners of company who were very, very personable. Travel assignments were highly interesting and educational; enhanced my love of our great military!!! As Benefits coordinator, learned invaluable insurance benefit processing for staff and value of a great benefits program. Looked forward to going to work each day. Hardest part of job was having to say good-bye when the contract ended.

Great management team. Team members are always ready to help.
Great place to learn a lot if you are willing to work hard. I love and enjoy what i do everyday.

Because it was a temporary contract job no benefits/ compensation were available to me. Job security and advancement opportunities weren’t a thing because of the same reason; but overall a wonderful experience got to meet new people and it was hard work for good pay. Love Mantech as a whole and I hope to work with them in the future.

employee_title: FBCB2 Family Of Systems Technical Lead
Review: Enjoy working with ManTech. They have great benefits, with a lot of available paid schooling to continue advancing your career. They work with you if you want to relocate to stay in the company.

review_title: A great place to work that is wiling to invest in your future.
Review:
ManTech is big on education and promoting a learning environment.
They strive to place employees in positions that they will flourish and grow, and will work with you to ensure you are happy with your work.
Toxic and hostile is the least you can say about this experience. False leaders with hidden agendas to make themselves look better and throw you under the bus.
I'm still considered a new employee. I'm just observing and learning. I will be more knowledgeable and able to write more once I'm six months into the job.
Working for Mantech is a great opportunity to further your prowess and develop your skill set. There are numerous paths to be taken and help is provided every step of the way!
I worked for a company that was acquired by ManTech. I've seen great benefits in a very collaborative environment. I'm looking forward to growing and staying in the ManTech family for years to come.
Great place to work. Great training and mentors. Easy commute and strong government cyber security presence. Learning is part of the ManTech experience. leadership is always helpful

Contractor position while working out of the DC area, the biggest thing you have to get used to is contracts end and sometimes with only a 2-week notice. Luckily I was able to obtain a new job with a different company with 36-hours.

Management was good, while never really seen I knew I could reach out to them whenever. Just like contract work, you work with you your working for. Only down-side is they don't retain you and move you to another contract if the one your on ends.

Great company to work for. Lots of great trave opportunities. The work is fulfilling. The customer is appreciative of the efforlt necessary to get projects done. Opportunity for travel. Great benefits. The company invest employee development and allows you time to pursue educational opportunities.

review_title: A productive but relaxed place to work
Review:
Come into work and attend the morning "catch up" meeting, assist co-workers with assignments.

Learned to use the Joint Digital Collection and Review software used during data collection during tests conducted by the Electronic Proving Grounds.

Great management.

We knew how many vehicles we had to service for the entire week so we had time to setup a schedule to pace ourselves. The atmosphere was pleasant, and the team pulled together to get things done. Our product was always completed on time or ahead of schedule.

review_title: Run away, far away, from this company.
Review: Company is great at winning a contract but really sucks at trying to deliver on promises in order to keep that contract. Their solution to not having enough manpower to do the job at hand is to lay people off.

Working in operations, I was very frustrated at ManTech. The corporate support teams seemed to think that operations teams (aka billable projects) worked for them rather than the other way around as it should be. It was tough when you had to fight with your own contracts team, do your own recruiting, and deal with certain over-powered people.

review_title: Productive fun and challenging place to work.
Review: Great place to work managers are great and company allows employees to bank and make up time within a pay period. Can make up hrs anytime if you need a day off or need to leave early. Pay can benifits are great.

It was a good working environment. The hardest part of the job was the various work hours. It was shift work and hours were long. Job supervisor was good to work for and there was teamwork to accomplish the job.

The job was very easy but kept you busy. The customers were the best part of this job. I miss the soldiers I served while I was working for Mantech. I had an excellent management group that still keeps in touch now that I don't work there. Only reason I had to leave was due to budget cuts.

I enjoyed my time at ManTech. The company is very attentive to needs of their contractors. I did request training, and they were very attentive in providing links to Percipio for training on Cloud Technology.
ManTech promotes teamwork and collaboration. It is a fun environment to be around and management is supportive and understanding. Overall a great company!

Good place to work, good leadership who you will enjoy working for. Strong contracting company with decent opportunities.
Only complaint is compensation. Benefits aren't that great either.

review_title: At times it can be fun but you can not for get where we are at..
Review: At times it can be fun but we can not for get where we at noting else to say about working for ManTech at this time but it a good company you grow with this company if you want

In my opinion, management does the best they can. For many of the managers I have worked for, they were working in multiple roles and often times that is hard to do. This company offers excellent benefits to include professional and self development programs. Overall, this is a great company to work for, and like other organizations it isn't perfect but I do see the effort in working towards improvements.

Program manager has workday scheduled for you doing IT for the company. Company solicits input from its worksforce to improve how work is completed. Company changes directions and flows with how the customer wants work accomplished.

Plan, implement, upgrade, or monitor security measures for the protection of computer networks and information. May ensure appropriate security controls are in place that will safeguard digital files and vital electronic infrastructure. May respond to computer security breaches and viruses.

review_title: Great place to work but still has some work to do overall
Review: ManTech preaches internal growth and development but doesn't back it up when it comes to internal candidates. If you do get an interview the salary is at the cheap end and Compensation is very scarce. If you want quality people you need to pay for them. Work/life balance is average at best, especially if you're not a Manager/Director. Corporate building looks like something from the 1980s and needs a serious upgrade compared to other locations that ManTech has. I just hope ManTech takes internal candidates more seriously and not just check a box or a stat. Be more flexible when it comes to working from home. Let people work in cross departments that they are interested in moving to so they can learn what it takes from the people that are doing it at a high level. Be innovative and grow ManTech within.
Definitely believes in work life balance. Needs to do a better job in finding Leadership. The benefits are great, but they could compensate a little better within the team.

review_title: very active and be around of surroundings
Review: high fast pace moving job. have to be knowledgeable of the information you are getting visitors. Information systems training is mandatory and monthly.

ManTech has some of the best benefits in the NCR. The most enjoyable part of the job is working with the most talented people who love sharing their knowledge. The hardest part of the job is the commute. A Lot of the upper management do not know how to appropriately speak to employees because they do not get management training.
Great place to work. Great training and mentors. Easy commute and strong government cyber security presence. Learning is part of the ManTech experience. leadership is always helpful
Great managers. Good pay and benefits. Some travel and sometimes to austere areas. Would work for them again. This 150 character minimum is a bunch of garbage.

review_title: Exciting and friendly enviornment to work for the Crane, In.
Review: Mantech is one of the best places to be employed. I would recommend ManTech to anyone that wants a rewarding and fulfilling government contracting position.
Great place to work. Company puts employees first and their families. Great benifits and managment is great. Can bank extra vacation hours during the current pay period.
While I didn't actually work in an office space within Mantech (I was a contractor), the company and benefits were good. My immediate supervisor was helpful and friendly.

Government contractor with various contracts, particularly with DOD and VA. The company works about the same as other government contractors. They have a very restrictive leave policy and an excellent health plan. Easy to get laid off there.
I would say mantech benefits are high and for the amount of work i do on a daily basis i believe that my pay could be a little higher. My position is really busy and stressful at times.

review_title: Dream big but manage to fall a bit short from time to time
Review: In the excitement to supply members on contracts sometimes those hired are not as qualified as they should be. Training to get those not as qualified on par with other members can also be difficult. Hiring Site Leads and Program Managers who do not know the legal boundary line on what Contract should and should not legally be asked to do. over 6 people quit in a two month time frame due to their negligence at one of their sites.

review_title: Good company with benefits and competitive salary
Review: MANTECH is a good company to work for as they provide a good work environment. They have competitive salaries, good benefits and fair time off policies.

employee_title: Personnel Security Officer and Site Leader
Review: Great company to work for. ManTech offers a vast amount of courses to promote professional and personal educational goals. The company also offers courses to promote internal.
Know what you are getting into and be prepared for a contract renewal cycles. Once you are on a site, you don't have much oversight from the corporation, other than what you supervisor passes down.

review_title: Poor management with lack of oversight
Review: Some locations are great... others are horrible. Contract management has no oversight from corporate. Run away from their Pentagon contract. Management seems to be a popularity contest not based on experience.
There is a great culture at ManTech and they take care of their employees. From day one, they made me feel at home and we have great leadership. I would recommend them to anyone.

review_title: Productive, educational, very collaborative with other teams.
Review: I wanted to keep working with the employees. Never really had a problem with team but management could have been more forthcoming in giving feedback.

review_title: I have enjoyed working for ManTech
Review: This company has offered a number of opportunities including educational advancement. A great deal of support has also been provided while working for the Client. There are times that this is really needed because this can be the hardest part of the job. The most enjoyable part is when we have delivered above their expectations.

review_title: Challenging workplace, must be able to redirect efforts when needed.
Review: ManTech is a challenging, but rewarding workplace. I have had an opportunity to learn from industry leaders in the field of Import/Export, shipping of dangerous good and DoD procedures.

Since leaving the military, this position has helped to keep the skills I learned fresh and also to build new experiences.

Great working environment with co-workers
Very knowledgeable and great trainers

Management strongly encourages advancements into other duties and positions

review_title: It is ok to work here
Review: ManTech was an overall good company to work for. They have for the most part a flexible work schedule. Management is ok, however, their HR department could definitely use some help.
I really loved the job and the working atmosphere. Working along side of management was very insightful. I would do it all over again if given the opportunity.

location: Patuxent River Naval Air Station, MD
Review: I loved the people I worked with and the opportunities that I was given to progress with my family being a single father of 5. I had a great and challenging time with ManTech International and met a lot of great people. had a challenging time learning the ins and outs of ManTech due to issues with a poor ManTech Manager but learned to work together as a cohesive unit in the grand scheme of things and accomplished a lot.

review_title: A great stepping stone into an IT career
Review: ManTech is a great company to work for. They are very accomodating with work/life balance, the compensation is good and they do promote growth and development.
Great place to work. Great training and mentors. Easy commute and strong government cyber security presence. Learning is part of the ManTech experience. leadership is always helpful

I would brief the team on tasks that needed to be accomplished. Management always encouraged learning. The hardest part of the job was working most weekends and holidays to support the mission. The most enjoyable part of my job was interacting with the Soldiers on a daily basis.

employee_title: Dept of Veterans Affairs - Systems Engineer II
review_title: Kforce was a great company to work for.
Review: Kforce was a great company to work for. Good training, great support, great technical support for the project. Project of upgrading the SCCM infrastructure was completed successfully. Disappointed the contract ended.
ManTech appeared to be a good company to work with. The office I was in had a great knowledgeable group of people who cared about the Marine Corp and it mission.

Overall rating is above average, considering all things. More telework would be appreciated. A typical day at work is extremely busy most times but not overwhelming on a regular basis. Colleagues are great to work with however, management could be improved upon. Workload requires additional staff, but motto appears to be do "more with less". Hardest part of the job is massive policies and procedures and administrative requirements in subcontracts. Very doable with the right amount of staff, but current staff level does not allow for sufficient ability to meet each and every requirement.
I enjoyed the majority of my time there. The people that I worked with had the best personalities. I also enjoyed working with the customers that I interfaced with.

review_title: Good job for a transitional period but not a career.
Review: This job is low stress but has very limited career potential and barely pays a wage that is necessary to survive in this metropolitan area. The co-workers are cordial and the workload is very reasonable when viewed in relation to the pay schedule.

I truly enjoyed working for Mantech. I knew about Mantech when I was still on Active Duty before I retired. I was with them when I retired from the military. I was with them for seven years. I would still be with them if it wasn't for the contract being renewed and they gave my positon to a person who was not qualified for my positon.
Very good company, places value on family as well as work. Provides all tools and training necessary for advancement and promotion. Allows personnel to work on varying schedule to accomplish task.
You will work hard everyday to prove yourself. The pay is not bad because I worked overseas but the physical and mental demand will test your resolve everyday.

review_title: Great job for travel to all the places you'll never want to go.
Review: My personal experience with ManTech has been working on Military Contracts. I worked Avionics Systems for the Army. Great job but didn't enjoy it because of ManTech's cumbersome policies and procedures. I worked twelve years with four various contractors and was even a Government employee for two years. By far, ManTech, was the worst employer out of them all.
Kforce always ensured that the team work was in sync with Federal Leadership directives. I was able to participate in the CMMI Level-3 Certification of the Department of Veterans Affairs.
I am working on a government contract that is starting its 4 year of a 5 year contract. The contract has been going through transition as we have moved from waterfall to SAFe.

review_title: Flexible hours, relaxed management, pitiful everything else
Review:
Salary and benefits are honestly what kills this company. Couple this with poor management on behalf of the administrative side of the company, and it rapidly becomes a toxic place to work.

We've been left regularly in the dark about personnel actions until the very last minute, such as salary actions. Moreover, as raises do come in, the company has a profoundly horrendous habit of rewarding their best performing employees anything of value, this in conjunction with the company already underpaying you.

It's a great main to get into if you're a first timer but it's a terrible place to stay.
Enjoyed my time working with ManTech. management is great and not only takes care of people but also value your work. I won't mind working for them again.
Man Tech is an awesome place to work. Great Company !!!awesome company!!! they really care about there people. I recommend ManTech to anybody. awesome Company.

Work got done and had a great manager.
Getting to work was a good commute.
I like the project we were working on.
All my Coworkers were great and we work together good.
Lots of demands as a SAMS1-E clerk. Had to use own cell phone with no cell phone reimbursement. Great salary advancements, lots of get classes to take.

review_title: Results oriented workplace with clearly defined performance objectives
Review: A strong corporate environment focused on sustaining customer satisfaction, while meeting growth objectives designed to meet quarterly forecasts for revenue and profitability for a publicly traded firm.

review_title: This company does not have a career advancement
Review: There is no career advancement, it is a good body system. If someone recommends you then you can get advanced in your career. Management does wrong and they just slap them on the hand.

Over 20 years of combined experience in on-site vertical construction projects as an Electronic Technician and Infrastructure Team Lead while inspecting quality output ensuring assignments conform to SPAWAR guidelines manufacturer specifications and schematic drawings. Experience includes electronics, technologies operations, design, deployment and troubleshootingwork from an office until we had to travel for work. Travel was about 75% working overtime.
Great place to work. Great training and mentors. Easy commute and strong government cyber security presence. Learning is part of the ManTech experience. leadership is always helpful

ManTech mainly provides jobs on government contracts. Contracts can end at anytime so job security is not great. However, salaries and benefits are good while the contract is in effect. Almost all jobs require a government security clearance.

Excellent company to work for. Work and Family values respected. Excellent hours and pay.

Training opportunity and promotion opportunities were great.

I was given the opportunity to advance within the company from an ET1, to a Field Engineer. I was able to travel and learn other ways of doing things that made me a better, more effective leader within the Reliability, Availability, and Maintainability (RAM) section at Ft. Huachuca, AZ.
This was a great place to work learn and grow. The management provided clear direction and were open to helping those on their team. I found that I like the experience of working here.
ManTech is doing well in acquiring new contracts and growing the business pipeline. There's not much to the culture. The business systems need update.
ManTech is a wonderful stepping stone company to get your feet wet in the World of Defense Contracting. I enjoy working with the company, however I feel as though my career has plateaued.

Mantech company overall is a great company to work for, the benifits were competitive and the company took care of their employees needs. The management was involved in the day to day operations which instilled stucture and good work ethics. I enjoyed my employment mostly because I worked in my job field.
The company is as good as your leadership. Direct leadership tier two seems to be outstanding past that the leadership seems to be out of touch which is to be as expected.

review_title: Wait for a better offer, too much disorganization
Review:
I wanted to like ManTech when I started but here is my experience, check with others and it will be the same:
-very high turnover and low retention of top talent, including managers
-contracts are low bid so best employees always resign
-pay well below market unless a friend brings you in
-I personally had 7 managers in 16 months
-witnessed gender and age discrimination
-now that original founder retired, I am guessing they are positioning at least half of this company to sell off, thats why so cheap
-cannot recommend this company especially to new grads
KFORCE was ok to work for. They are in a different situation being a government contractor and they have to abide by the rules of their customer. Most KFORCE employees are happy.
Lack of resources for the project. High turnover rate. it is a revolving door, and unrealistic project assignments, where they wanted to build a program, but there is a lack of resources.
I have lasting relationships with people that worked there. Hardest part was learning a language that i was not previously familiar with but everyone was patient and willing to help.

Give you the ablility to work with all facets of Network perssonal. It's a rare place to work when Infrastructure, Boundary Protection, HBSS, Messaging, etc all work on the same floor and converse on the issues at hand.

A great company to work for.

Beyond that, I will not submit to the Indeed requirement to publicly discuss my current company. Thus, space filled.....

Management was out-of-sight and out-of-mind...only to pop up with bad news. You were seen only as the direct contract job you were staffed to fill and you had to sell yourself again each contract renewal or award, competing with outside staff and inside staff for jobs instead of there being a feeling that you were part of Mantech and appreciated for what you can provide. Was absorbed into Mantech from an acquisition and always felt as though they resented the staff that came over from the acquisition. Why did I stay so long? I worked 100% remote and my pay was fair for my role.
Not the best place to work for but the worst. Management plays favorites. Promotes a lazy and toxic culture. Seems to be proud that they are on the lower end of pay.
Working at Mantech is fast paced and challenging. Managers care about the employees and ensure their employees are provide with what they need to succeed.

Enjoyed working a contract on the Local Military Installation. Left due to contract cuts. Manager were good and we had a solid relationship with the government. I would go back if the right opportunity presented itself

When you are a Part time on call ( PTOC) you job isn't secured as the test are done and you may or may not be called back to test again
for part time on call you do more than 40 hours and the weather can effect testing

Government contracting for CMS is very competitive. This generates a desire/need to consistently provide superior service if you want to retain your contract (s). This is clearly a positive, but can negatively affect work/life balance (normal for IT).
ManTech has superior staff in most departments. My division had its share of Drs. I improved my overall management skills on a weekly basis, gleaning from co workers, superiors, subordinates as well as constant on-line training. I enjoyed the environment despite the uncertainty of job security with contract work.
Great place to work. Great training and mentors. Easy commute and strong government cyber security presence. Learning is part of the ManTech experience. leadership is always helpful

I used to love coming to work everyday, but not so much anymore.

The morale is at an all time low and people are starting to get fed up because how they are treated by management. This is why the turnout rate is so high.

The people who have been put into Management / Director positions all seem to have personal agendas and taking care of the people who make things happen isn't one of them.

review_title: I really enjoyed working for ManTech
Review:
Personnel Security admin work.
Reinvestigations.
Management was great.
Workplace culture was fine.
Finding a place to park.
The work, people & mgmt.
This Job has many directions on can go in. With supporting a lot of company world wide. There is room for growth in your career here. Some office cultures are different then others.

This job challenges one to constantly learn. Because auditors, software, processes change all the time, one must adapt. I've spent countless hours documenting processes, however, they become obsolete.

The most enjoyable part of the job is find solutions that weren't readily available, however, the worst part is when other people aren't able to assist you in solving problems when they have the expertise to do so.

review_title: A very nice place to work
Review: A very fast paced and good place to work. Management is very good and the workplace is goal oriented and steady. A place to learn new skills and pick up valuable work lessons.

I've learned my administrative skills from there. They helped show me that you can be anything that you really attempt to be if you try your hardest. I came in early to help people knock out some tasks before I got to my scheduled visits. And they wouldn't have to wait until the end of my schedule. I became a part-time supervisor their for another faction of the job.The coworkers were always willing to give a helping hand as well!

review_title: Changing culture from appreciation to comodity
Review: Working at MT is what you make of it. You can excel through earned promotions yet employees at large are treated as commodities as they are easily replaced. Promotions are often managed through counter offers rather than recognition. Kevin Phillips does an exceptional job setting the example however the management team needs more coaching.

review_title: Excellent company for military and analytical folk
Review:
In my field of modeling and simulation I worked with my team to ascertain customer needs, obtain relevant data, and then my task was to manage it in a database. I perform database transformation on this data to construct model input. I also assisted in data visualization and analysis of the model output.

Their tuition assistance program helped me get my higher ed degree!

building and sustaining a healthy workplace culture, it’s necessary to ask the question, “are we a team here, or are we a family?” A team has a common goal. The needs and positions of the team may vary, but the end result is to win. This means that teammates build up their fellow comrades, celebrate their successes, and encourage them when they’ve had a down moment. They come together to bond and unite for the greater outcome. At times, this may mean picking up the extra slack or offering to assist in an area outside of your “job description.” We do this willingly, because we know that when we put in the time, the team shares in the fruits of the labor, and that the commitment to that common goal benefits everyone.

Often times you hear businesses say, “We’re a family here.” Though that may be a good theory, difficulties remain, as you most likely won’t fire a family member because they have been late 365 days in a row. While a family environment encourages personal relationships, a sense of community and a feeling of security, it may also discourage competition, lower expectations, or struggle with visible accountability.

All my work was on site or at remote work locations.

My team was good but some of the clients were challenging.

Overall I enjoyed both of my tenures at Mantech and would work there again happily.

Many managers wonder where to start when they’re faced with putting together a performance review. Our suggestion: review the job description. Whether it’s for a waiter, a food runner, a customer service rep, or something else entirely, ask yourself these questions as the basis for the rest of your review:

Did the employee satisfy all the responsibilities and requirements listed in the job description?
Were there certain aspects left lacking?
I have only been working here for a short period of time. I will continue to do my part as a team member unless something else or other opportunities come my way.
Really like the company, but I have been contracting overseas for over ten year and it was time for me to go home. ..........................................

When I came onto ManTech, I found myself working with individuals who were the best in their respective roles and responsibilities. I was provided challenging work and opportunities to develop skills I already acquired in previous roles. I was able to provide impact to the project I found myself on, and develop good working relationships with the client and my coworkers over the course of a few months.

However, it occurred to me that ManTech acquired these individuals through acquisition, and had moved previous management out with their own. New management began to remove those individuals in favor of saving costs and the project suffered. Those that remained flagged severe issues within the project, and reminded management of how critical certain individuals were. None of this was taken into consideration.

Currently, I find myself in several meetings over the course of a week, unable to finish work I was brought on for. Management continues to shirk responsibility for the current status, and waves off issues brought up by teams. ManTech acquired excellent talent, but seems unable to retain it through their dismissal of legitimate concerns and pain points. ManTech might be a good company, but my experience in my current role on this project is anything but.

This was a great company to work for, and they paid higher wages than their competitors. I work there for over 7 years. The only downside was in my particular situation, there was little room for advancement.

location: Heavy Vehicle Mechanic / Team Lead (Former Employee)
Review: Good company, well ran, takes care of their people, pays well, good management, good housing. That should be sufficient to get an idea of working for Mantech.

Honestly I have no complaints, The reason I put 2 stars for Job security is because.... it is contracting and that in its self means very little security. I enjoy working with my boss and the company.

This company has managers that bullied me and a co-worker for reporting the bullying to Human Resources. Then they bullied me even more until I resigned. The upper level management promotes bullying and retailation of employees who report it. Stay away from this company because I am still living with the trauma of what happened to me there and I don't want anyone else to go thru this.
Working at ManTech we would have assignments that required us to do things independently as well as with a team and I was able to excel at both. I love the opportunity to work with others.
My department were great people to work with. We were solid as a team and had fun while performing our tasks. Communications within the department were flawless and support was impeccable.
